definition: voice change (at puberty)/to alter one's voice (deliberately)/to sound different (when angry etc)
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: But, his changeable sound scheduled time abrupt arrival.
sentences.chinese: 可是，他的變聲期突然到來了。

sentences.english: The boy's voice has not cracked yet.
My son was about 14 when his voice broke .
sentences.chinese: 我兒子14歲左右開始變聲。

sentences.english: However, his voice a view to a sudden change has arrived.
sentences.chinese: 可是，他的變聲期突然到來了。

sentences.english: Signs include change in voice and difficulty breathing.
sentences.chinese: 症狀包括變聲和呼吸困難。

sentences.english: At present his voice is changing; that is phase all boys go through.
sentences.chinese: 目前他正在變聲，這是所有男孩都要經歷的一個階段。

definition: vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
full of sap (idiom); young and vigorous
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
